skills.name: Substitute negative integer values into expressions involving no powers or roots

explanations.A: We are told that n = 1.5. Substituting this into the left-hand side: 5n = 5 âœ• 1.5 = 7.5. Now substituting this into the right-hand side: n ï¼‹ 5 = 1.5 ï¼‹ 5 = 6.5. The inequality sign points to the smaller value, and so 7.5 > 6.5.
explanations.B: Just be careful with your substitution. Remember that 5n means 5 x n.
explanations.C: Just be careful with your substitution. Remember that 5n means 5 x n.
explanations.D: We are told that n = 1.5, so we can swap the n in each of the answers to 1.5 and then we can see which is correct. Remember that 5n means 5 x n.

explanations.A: Just be careful with your substitution. Remember that 3n means 3 x n.
explanations.B: We are told that n = 2.5. Substituting this into the left-hand side: 3n = 3 âœ• 2.5 = 7.5. Now substituting this into the right-hand side: 4n âˆ’ 2 = 10 âˆ’ 2 = 8. The inequality sign points to the smaller value, and so 7.5 < 8.
explanations.C: Just be careful with your substitution. Remember that 3n means 3 x n.
explanations.D: We are told that n = 2.5, so we can swap the n in each of the answers to 2.5 and then we can see which is correct. Remember that 3n means 3 x n.

explanations.A: Just be careful with your substitution. Remember that 5n means 5 x n.
explanations.B: We are told that n = âˆ’1. Substituting this into the left-hand side: 5n = 5 âœ• âˆ’1 = âˆ’5. Now substituting this into the right-hand side: n ï¼‹ 5 = âˆ’1 ï¼‹ 5 = 4. The inequality sign points to the smaller value, and so âˆ’5 < 4.
explanations.C: 5n means 5 x n, which isn't the same as 5 + n. Try changing the n for -1 in each of the answers to see which is true.
explanations.D: We are told that n = -1, so we can swap the n in each of the answers to -1 and then we can see which is correct. Remember that 5n means 5 x n.

explanations.A: Just be careful with your substitution. Remember that 3n means 3 x n.
explanations.B: Just be careful with your substitution. Remember that 3n means 3 x n.
explanations.C: We are told that n = âˆ’2. Substituting this into the left-hand side: 3n = 3 âœ• âˆ’2 = âˆ’6. Now substituting this into the right-hand side: 4n âˆ’ 2 = âˆ’8 âˆ’ 2 = âˆ’10. The inequality sign points to the smaller value, and so âˆ’6 > âˆ’10.
explanations.D: We are told that n = -2, so we can swap the n in each of the answers to -2 and then we can see which is correct. Remember that 3n means 3 x n.

explanations.A: I think you added the 1.8 and 7 rather than multiplying them. Remember 1.8C means 1.8 x C
explanations.B: I think you put the 1.8 and 7 together rather than multiplying them. Remember 1.8C means 1.8 x C
explanations.C: The question tells us that ğ¶ has a value of 7. Substituting this in, taking care to note that 1.8ğ¶ = 1.8 Ã— ğ¶, gives ğ¹ = 1.8 Ã— 7 + 32 = 12.6 + 32 = 44.6
explanations.D: I think you added the 1.8 and 32, and then multiplied by 7. You need to do 1.8 x C + 32

explanations.A: The question tells us that ğ¶ has a value of 12. Substituting this in but taking care to note that 1.8ğ¶ = 1.8 Ã— ğ¶ gives ğ¹ = 1.8 Ã— 12 + 32 = 12.6 + 32 = 53.6
explanations.B: I think you added the 1.8 and 32, and then multiplied by 12. You need to do 1.8 x C + 32
explanations.C: I think you added the 1.8 and 12 rather than multiplying them. Remember 1.8C means 1.8 x C
explanations.D: I think you put the 1.8 and 12 together rather than multiplying them. Remember 1.8C means 1.8 x C

explanations.A: I think you have multiplied by 2 rather than squaring. When we square we have to multiply the number by itself
explanations.B: Almost, just remember 2as means 2 x a x s, we don't just put the numbers next to each other.
explanations.C: The two elements of this formula are ğ‘¢Â² = ğ‘¢ Ã— ğ‘¢ and 2ğ‘ğ‘  = 2 Ã— ğ‘ Ã— ğ‘ . These are then added together. Substituting in the values ğ‘¢ = 10, ğ‘ = 2 and ğ‘  = 6 gives ğ‘£Â² = (10 Ã— 10) + (2 Ã— 2 Ã— 6) = 100 + 24 = 124
explanations.D: Almost, just remember 2as means 2 x a x s, we don't add them.

explanations.A: For this formula, 1/(2ğ‘) = 1/(2 Ã— 5) = 1/10 is multiplied by (ğ‘£Â² âˆ’ğ‘¢Â²) = [(8 Ã— 8) âˆ’ (4 Ã— 4)] = 64 â€“ 16 = 48. This gives an answer of 48 Ã· 10 = 4.8
explanations.B: Almost, just remember 2a means 2 x a, we don't just put the numbers next to each other.
explanations.C: Not quite. Remember 2a means 2 x a, we don't just put the numbers next to each other. Also squaring means we multiply the number by itself.
explanations.D: Almost, but we can't do the subtract before the squaring. We have to do the 8 squared and then subtract the 4 squared.

explanations.A: You are really close. Remember the t at the end means you are multiplying by t, not adding.
explanations.B: Almost. The t is on the outside of the bracket so we don't half that as well.
explanations.C: Not quite. We need to multiply by t rather than adding it. Also check where your brackets are.

explanations.A: Not quite, I think you have added the 1/ğ‘ value instead of multiplying.
explanations.B: Almost, but remember it is 1/a not just a that we are multiplying by.

Multiplying by 1/ğ‘ (or 1/4.1) is the same as dividing by a, so the calculation can be simplified to (8.7 âˆ’ 2.8) Ã· 4.1, answer D.
